definition: can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: Would you like to recieve our updates through Email?
sentences.chinese: 你希望我们用电邮知会你最新资讯吗？

sentences.english: They always sent their beadle the day before to say they were coming.
sentences.chinese: 在他们来之前，总是先派一个小职员来知会他们要来。

sentences.english: Mason orders Tony to alert the field unit about what Jack revealed.
sentences.chinese: 梅森命令托尼将杰克透露的情报知会外勤部队。

definition: to pass on a story/to communicate a message
to expect/to presume/to think (sth is likely)
to show an interest in/to get involved with
to go on a journey/to leave
to make inquiries/to try to find out/to pry
to make discreet inquiries/to scout out
to inconvenience/to trouble (sb with a request)
